key_points: A fourth student, a 17-year-old boy, died from wounds in a Michigan high school shooting, totaling four students dead.
The shooter, a sophomore, opened fire at Oxford High School, injuring eight others, some critically.
Oakland County Sheriff Michael Bouchard reported the difficulty in determining a motive as the shooter is not communicating.
The shooter was arrested shortly after the incident; the firearm used was recently purchased by his father.
Victims include 16-year-old Tate Myre, 14-year-old Hana St. Juliana, 17-year-old Madisyn Baldwin, and 17-year-old Justin Shilling.
The suspect's parents advised him not to talk to investigators, complicating inquiry efforts.
Authorities are investigating social media posts and school video footage for potential motives.
Rumors of a school threat circulated on social media prior to the shooting, but officials found no substantial threats.
All schools in the district were closed for the rest of the week following the shooting.
A vigil was held, reflecting the community's shock and mourning after the incident.
spokespersons: Isabel Flores (Student at Oxford High School)
